function.description: Appends content to an existing note. If a folder is specified, the note is created in that folder; otherwise, it's created in the default folder. Returns the status of the content appending.

function.name: get_phone_number
function.description: Search for a contact by name. Returns the phone number of the contact.

function.name: open_note
function.description: Opens an existing note by its name. If a folder is specified, the note is created in that folder; otherwise, it's created in the default folder. Returns the content of the note.

function.name: send_sms
function.description: Send an SMS to a list of phone numbers. The recipients argument can be a single phone number or a list of phone numbers. Returns the status of the SMS.

function.name: compose_new_email

function.name: get_zoom_meeting_link
function.description: Creates a Zoom meeting and returns the join URL. You need to call create_calendar_event to attach the zoom link as a note to the calendar event. topic, start_time, duration, and meeting_invitees are required. duration is in minutes. The format for start_time is 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS'.

function.description: Opens the file and returns its path.

function.name: create_note

function.name: create_reminder

Otherwise, just leave it as empty string.

function.name: get_zoom_meeting_link

function.name: open_and_get_file_path

function.name: create_calendar_event
function.description: Create a calendar event. The format for start_date and end_date is 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS'. For invitees, you need a list of email addresses; use an empty list if not applicable. For location, notes, and calendar, use an empty string or None if not applicable. Returns the status of the event creation.

function.name: create_reminder
function.description: Creates a new reminder and returns the status of the reminder creation. The format for due_date is 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS'. If 'all_day' is True, then the format is 'YYYY-MM-DD'. The list_name is optional, use an empty string if not applicable. The priority is optional and defaults to 0. The all_day parameter is optional and defaults to False.

function.name: open_note
function.description: Opens an existing note by its name. If a folder is specified, the note is created in that folder; otherwise, it's created in the default folder. Returns the content of the note.

question.content: "Create a note titled 'Performance Notes' with the key points discussed during the team celebration in the folder 'Personal Notes' and reply to the latest email summarizing the celebration outcomes." Actually, the note should be created in the "Work Notes" folder, not "Personal Notes."

function.name: create_note
function.description: Creates a new note with the given content. The name is used as the title of the note. The content is the main text of the note. The folder is optional, use an empty string if not applicable. Returns the status of the note creation.

function.name: open_and_get_file_path
function.description: Opens the file and returns its path.

function.name: reply_to_email
function.description: Replies to the currently selected email in Mail with the given content. The cc parameter can be a single email or a list of emails. The attachments parameter can be a single file path or a list of file paths. The context parameter is optional and should only be used to pass down some intermediate result. Otherwise, just leave it as empty string.

function.name: summarize_pdf
function.description: Summarizes the content of a PDF file and returns the summary. This tool can only be used AFTER calling open_and_get_file_path tool to get the PDF file path.

ground_truth_function_calls: create_note("Performance Notes", "Key points discussed during the team celebration will be added here.", "Work Notes")

function.name: create_note
function.description: Creates a new note with the given content. The name is used as the title of the note. The content is the main text of the note. The folder is optional, use an empty string if not applicable. Returns the status of the note creation.

function.name: forward_email
function.description: Forwards the currently selected email in Mail with the given content. The recipients and cc parameters can be a single email or a list of emails. The attachments parameter can be a single file path or a list of file paths. The context parameter is optional and should only be used to pass down some intermediate result. Otherwise, just leave it as empty string.

function.name: get_email_address
function.description: Search for a contact by name. Returns the email address of the contact.

function.name: open_and_get_file_path
function.description: Opens the file and returns its path.
